intro: Laseguea obliquinervia, commonly known as the narrow-veined larkspur, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the family Ranunculaceae, which includes many showy and often toxic plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, branched stems and clusters of small, blue to purple flowers. Its leaves are typically palmately divided with a distinct, narrow venation pattern. Laseguea obliquinervia is often found in moist, shady habitats at high elevations.
